intro: Stoebe muricata, commonly known as rough fireweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant produces showy purple or blue flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in open fields, roadsides, and forest edges. Stoebe muricata is known for its adaptability and resilience in various environmental conditions.
